snippet: The billionaire former mayor of New York will spend an unspecified amount to support a proposal for a tax of 1 cent per ounce on sugary drinks in the city.
abstract: Michael R Bloomberg, who made curbing consumption of sugary drinks hallmark of his New York mayoral tenure, has donated $85,000 to Berkeley, Calif, campaign to have voters impose 1-cent-an-ounce tax on such drinks; donation is bid to equalize spending disparity between proponents of tax, who have raised $135,000, and beverage industry, which has spent $1.4 million to block tax.
lead_paragraph: The billionaire former mayor of New York will spend an unspecified amount to support a proposal for a tax of 1 cent per ounce on sugary drinks in the city.

headline.main: Bloomberg to Back Soda Tax in Berkeley
